episodes.title: S7E2: The Disappearing Sister
episodes.description: By the mid-1920s, Aimee Semple McPherson had it all — a megachurch, a radio empire, and a captivated nation. But in May 1926, she vanished. Was she kidnapped? Was it a hoax? Or had she simply run away from it all? This episode also examines the grand jury investigations, ensuing media circus, and, a turning point in Aimee’s ministry — when the lines blur between faith, power, and scandal. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: S7E1: Farm Girl From Ontario
episodes.description: In 1923, Aimee Semple McPherson founded America's first megachurch, Angelus Temple, in Los Angeles, California. But how did this farm girl from Ontario become the most famous preacher in North America? How did she turn her sermons into showstoppers? And how did she influence the way religion & politics are entangling today? This the first episode in a series that will examine both her rise to fame and her role in one of the biggest unsolved mysteries in American religious history. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: The Trouble With Sean Feucht
episodes.description:
Sean Feucht is a prolific worship leader and the posterboy for Christian Nationalism, he's also a main character in the Heaven Bent Universe. On this episode, what's his connection to the unrest in Los Angeles this weekend? Why have some former team members launched a public campaign against him? And why does this call for a re-listen to S2E1?

 Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: S7 Trailer: The Rise of Sister Aimee
episodes.description: At the beginning of the 20th century, evangelicalism was seen as a dying movement within Christianity. Then, seemingly out of nowhere, came Aime Semple McPherson. Aimee mixed religion with Hollywood-level showmanship to amass a global following and bring evangelicalism to the forefront. A lone female preacher in a sea of men, she founded America's first megachurch and became a pioneer televangelist. But what did it take to build a following of that scale? And who helped her get there? The answers will reveal a complicated history about the fight to put faith back in American politics *Starts June 16th, 2025 Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: Heaven Bent: Behind The Mic
episodes.description: A researcher from the University of Georgia recently asked Tara Jean to be a part of a study. It's focus was on content creators whose work impacts people who are leaving or questioning a belief or community that define a large part of someone's identity. So, normally, she's the one doing the interviewing, but not on this episode. Why did Tara Jean start making Heaven Bent? Who is her podcast for? Is she a documentarian? An ally? A meddler? Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: The File Of Evidence
episodes.description: If there's a "file of evidence" that proves prophet Shawn Bolz is a fraud, why didn't anyone alert the public? On the final episode of this miniseries, Jubilee's journey from victim to whistleblower. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: Bleed For Your Husband
episodes.description: Jubilee married Ted because prophet Shawn Bolz said that's what God wanted. But would God want Jubilee to marry a man who would nearly kill her? Also, how did 'Purity Culture' override Jubilee's abilities to trust her own instincts?? Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: The Smartphone Prophet
episodes.description: He is one of the most-acclaimed 'prophets' in the modern-day church. But is Shawn Bolz a sheister, and, if he is, how did this stay a secret for so long? As new-evidence mounts against him, this 3-episode miniseries features a personal testimony from Jubilee, a woman who says one of Shawn's most-viral prophecies - nearly got her killed. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: The Whistleblower
episodes.description:
S5E5 The Letters To The Committee

Former Harvesters are telling sordid stories about Art Lucier & Harvest Ministries International. But what, if anything, should be done about it? And, might the book of Matthew be any help??

Established in 2003 by Art and Heather Lucier, Harvest Ministries International is a multifaceted ministry both to the City of Kelowna, as well as to the Dominion of Canada. HMI has had the privilege to establish and oversee the creation of the Canadian Firewall, a national 24/7 prayer wall and room, since July 1st 2020. HMI has also stood for the church of Canada, as we contend for God's blessings with the Battle For Canada's National Gatherings, as well as different Faith Fire Freedom events throughout Canada, and more recently, the incredible 'Finding Your Voice' women's conferences led by Heather Lucier and team.  HMI has also been instrumental in bringing together a most incredible 5 Fold ministry team and family called the Revival Reformation Alliance, or the RRA, giving anointed unified leadership for national events, while also overseeing the Kelowna Harvest Church.  Welcome to the family. 

Kelowna Harvest Church is a part of Harvest Ministries International, which is led by Art and Heather Lucier. Hearing from the Lord and moving from Kitimat, BC in May 2018, they have diligently worked to ensure that the ministry and the church continue to function and grow. With a call for revival, apostolic leadership and prophetic impartation, this powerful couple are preparing many gatherings for those who passionately seek God and desire to follow His call, no matter where it will take them or what it may cost.


If people are calling you “one of the most prophetic voices in Canada," you must have quite the backstory. Join Tara Jean Stevens, as she illuminates the ministry of Art Lucier, the “Apostolic Overseer” of Harvest Ministries International.

Heaven Bent

From the Toronto Blessing to the Bethel School of Supernatural Ministry. From the rise of Christian nationalism to the growing influence & power of the modern-day Prophetic Movement.

Part religion, part history, part true crime.

Featuring figures like Bill Johnson, Art Lucier, Shawn Bolz, Heidi Baker, Sean Feucht, and Mike Bickle—leaders who believe in the power of healing & prophecy, and, engaging in spiritual warfare against Satan & his demons.

About Your Host

Tara Jean Stevens has been a part of the Vancouver radio, television, & theatre scene for more than 2 decades. A captivating storyteller with an infectious spirit of fun & curiosity, Tara Jean is a two-time winner of the British Columbia Association of Broadcasters’ “Performer Of The Year” award. Which was Nominated for a 2021 Canadian Podcast Award for “Outstanding Documentary”. In her spare time, she is an amateur-sleuth; solving family mysteries & being generally nosy. 

Become a Patron - https://www.patreon.com/HeavenBent

Listen on Apple Podcasts - https://podcasts.apple.com/ca/podcast/heaven-bent/id1513489117

Spotify - https://open.spotify.com/show/7tRJcheTT2UxoGz7ujH8Vo?si=5cd6073de95643b3

Amazon Music - https://music.amazon.ca/podcasts/689ffb9e-312b-4387-9697-667cf03c680e/heaven-bent

03:02 Survivor Stories

08:46 The Open Letter
11:50 The Committee's Response

17:47 The Broader Impact

24:01 Addressing Abuse in Church
27:11 Final Pleas

episodes.title: Touch Not The Lord's Anointed
episodes.description: Bodybuilder. Missionary. Youth Pastor. On this episode, Tara Jean reveals what she’s discovered about Art Lucier’s past—from newspaper archives, to livestreams, to firsthand stories from former Harvesters. Art Lucier is the Apostolic Overseer of Harvest Ministries International. He’s also the founding leader of Kelowna Harvest Church, and the former founding leader of Kitimat Harvest Church. As these new episodes are being released, he is facing mounting allegations that have now led to him stepping down. But is he telling the truth. Is this just a bunch of "broken people" tellings lies? Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

On this first episode, Art’s son-in-law opens up about his experience with the Harvest, his transformative faith journey, and, the love story that changed everything. Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: S4 TRAILER: The International House of Prayer
episodes.description: The International House of Prayer, in Kansas City, Missouri, has been the #1 requested topic for a new season. So, here we go! Episodes coming September 25.The International House of Prayer, or IHOP as it's unofficially known, is a multi-million dollar, non-denominational, Christian organization that boasts a 24/7 Prayer Room. Thousands and thousands of people have been through its doors over nearly 25 years. In this season, we're taking a closer look at what happened there between 1999 and 2015, a period when the organization was experiencing exponential growth and their leadership was put to the test.

episodes.title: S3E7: The Big Ol' Ship
episodes.description: In the final episode of season three, the shocking truth about what actually happened at Emmanuel Church of Christ, on June 16th, 1987. And the verdict in the David Terry murder and arson trial. Plus, where has this journey left Sharon today and what does the future hold for her childhood church?Subscribe to Heaven Bent Plus for early access to episodes and bonus content, all ad-free.

episodes.title: S3E6: The Tongues Not of Their Own
episodes.description: Tara Jean helps Sharon trace Emmanuel’s roots back to the 1906 Azusa Street Revival, in Los Angeles. The revival marks the beginning of a painful racial split in the Pentecostal church, leading Tara Jean and Sharon on an exploration of the appropriation of Black culture in the white Pentecostal church.Subscribe to Heaven Bent Plus for early access to episodes and bonus content, all ad-free.

episodes.title: S3E5: The Women Preachers
episodes.description: Tara Jean shines a spotlight on the women and girls of Emmanuel Church of Christ, including founding Bishop-Overseer Nina May Pierce. How did she fight off the men in her church who thought they knew better? Sharon shares her own experience growing up as a girl in Emmanuel post-Nina's leadership. Subscribe to Heaven Bent Plus for early access to episodes and bonus content, all ad-free.

episodes.title: S3E4: The David Terry Trial
episodes.description: Emmanuel Pastor, David Terry faces murder and arson charges in a Tennessee court. What does his former lawyer remember about the trial? Also, Sharon confronts her dad about his memory of the trial and hears his perspective for the first time ever.Subscribe to Heaven Bent Plus for early access to episodes and bonus content, all ad-free.

episodes.title: S3E3: The Tabernacle
episodes.description: When the fire happened, in Nashville, Sharon was at Emmanuel’s church camp; speaking in tongues and crushing on boys. What dark secrets did the adults in her church keep from her? And why did they suspect a cult might be involved?  Subscribe to Heaven Bent Plus for early access to episodes and bonus content, all ad-free.

episodes.title: S3E2: The Bishop-Overseer
episodes.description: Sharon learns about the early days of Emmanuel Church of Christ and its intriguing legacy of female leadership. Can this in-depth look at the church's history help us better understand what led to the tragic events of 1987?Subscribe to Heaven Bent Plus for early access to episodes and bonus content, all ad-free.

episodes.title: S3E1: The Emmanuel Church of Christ
episodes.description: It's the morning of June 16th, 1987, in Nashville, Tennessee. Shortly after midnight, firefighters are called to a blaze at Emmanuel Church of Christ. What they find in the ashes would change this small Pentecostal congregation forever.  Thirty-five years later, Tara Jean Stevens begins to unravel this shocking crime.On the journey with her is Sharon Edwards. She was just a kid when the fire tore apart her church family. Today, she wants to know the truth about what happened.Subscribe to Heaven Bent Plus for early access to episodes and bonus content, all ad-free.

episodes.title: S3 TRAILER: Emmanuel Church of Christ
episodes.description: It’s 1987. Nashville, Tennessee. Emmanuel Church of Christ Oneness Pentecostal is up in flames and a mutilated body is found inside. Who did it? Why is the congregation’s beloved pastor missing? And could a Satanic cult be responsible, or was it something else equally sinister?In season three, host and creator Tara Jean Stevens reveals the shocking details surrounding this mysterious and thought-provoking murder. Along the way, she learns about the church itself and the people who once sat in its pews. Their story brings forward a deep history of tent revivals, gospel music, and a rare legacy of female preachers. Plus, as always, a whole lotta speakin’ in tongues!Subscribe to Heaven Bent Plus for early access to episodes and bonus content, all ad-free.

episodes.title: S2E8: The Heart Of Bethel
episodes.description: In the final episode this season, what’s truly at the heart of Bethel Church, in Redding, California? And, is it a cult?

episodes.title: S2E7: The Devil Himself
episodes.description: The eye-opening evolution of the image of Satan in the Evangelical Church. Plus, what does the Devil have to do with the results of the 2020 U.S. presidential election. If you ask the leaders of Bethel Church, in Redding, California. The answer is a whole Hell of a lot.

episodes.title: S2E6: The Once Gays
episodes.description: Can God cure someone of their homosexual desires? Tara Jean Stevens explores “conversion therapy” and the “ex-gay” movement, within Bethel Church.

episodes.title: S2E5: The Outbreak
episodes.description: A COVID-19 outbreak at Bethel School of Supernatural Ministry makes national headlines. And, Sean Feucht’s “Let Us Worship” tour hits Washington, DC. Is he right? Could this be a “tipping point for revival in America”? And how about his critics? Will this be the superspreader event they’re dreading?

episodes.title: S2E4: The Power To Heal
episodes.description: At Bethel Church, they believe in the power to heal the sick and raise the dead. What could possibly go wrong?

episodes.title: S2E3: The Bethel School of Supernatural Ministry
episodes.description: What happens at Bethel’s bewildering School of Supernatural Ministry? And how do they plan to keep students safe as they return to class during the COVID-19 pandemic?

episodes.title: S2E2: The City of Redding
episodes.description: How much influence and impact does Bethel Church have in Redding? Turns out… a lot. And many locals are not happy about it. Is a cult really trying to take over this Northern California town?

episodes.title: S2E1: The Freedom To Worship
episodes.description: In defiance of COVID-19 restrictions on mass gatherings and public singing, a Billboard charting worship leader from Redding, California launches a national, outdoor worship tour. Thousands of people show up at nearly every stop, and there’s barely ever a mask in sight. Is Sean Feucht a superspreader? Join Tara Jean Stevens, as she begins her exploration into Bethel Church, one of the largest and most unusual churches in America.

episodes.title: S1 BONUS: The Modern Prophetic Tour
episodes.description: You’ve never met. So, how does he know your phone number? Your children’s names? And what you do for work? On this final season 1 bonus episode, join Tara Jean Stevens as she takes a deeper look into the controversial ministry of prophet Shawn Bolz – a “pioneer” in the Apostolic Prophetic Movement.

episodes.title: Season 2: Inside America’s Most Unusual Church
episodes.description: Supernatural healings. Gold dust falling from the ceiling. Resurrections. Bethel Church, in Redding, California, is one of the largest and most unusual churches in America. What goes on inside its bewildering School of Supernatural Ministry? Is Bethel as powerful as its critics believe it to be? And, during the COVID-19 pandemic, why are its most high-profile leaders defying public health orders? In season 2 of Heaven Bent, join Tara Jean Stevens as she continues to track the “Toronto Blessing” – a bizarre spiritual movement that spread to her childhood church, and around the world.

episodes.title: S1 BONUS: The Most Evil Person Ever
episodes.description: Fire tunnels, gold dust, and a mysterious silver fleck. On this season 1 bonus episode: Tara Jean Stevens’ candid conversation with Bruce Vanden Berg. Like Tara Jean, he was once involved with the Toronto Blessing movement. Today, he has fond memories of his time with the church, but there also came a day when he knew he had to leave.

episodes.title: S1E5: The Gold Teeth
episodes.description: In March of 1999, more than 300 Christians claimed that gold teeth or fillings had miraculously appeared in their mouths. Can any of these “dental miracles” be verified? On this episode of Heaven Bent, Tara Jean Stevens returns to her childhood church in Prince Rupert, British Columbia, to find out. Also, on this final episode of the season, Tara Jean, herself a former follower, comes to some personal conclusions on the ‘Toronto Blessing’ movement.

episodes.title: S1E4: The River
episodes.description: In 1995, a pastor’s wife from Florida attended ‘Toronto Blessing’ services in Toronto, Canada. Just days after her return, the strange phenomena happening there started happening in her church back home in Brownsville. Was her trip a successful crowd-control reconnaissance mission? On this episode of Heaven Bent, Tara Jean Stevens tracks the spread of this controversial spiritual movement – where it spread, and why. Also, what’s the “new wine”? And what does it feel like to get “drunk in the spirit?”.

episodes.title: S1E3: The Carpet Time
episodes.description: Even the children fell to the floor, shaking and speaking in tongues. On this episode of Heaven Bent, Tara Jean Stevens explores the strange phenomenon known as “carpet time”. Was something supernatural at play? If not, what else could be going on? And, tracing the fascinating historical roots of the “Toronto Blessing,” we learn about the “Jesus Freaks” of the 1960s and 70s.

episodes.title: S1E2: The Gifts of the Spirit
episodes.description: They say she heals the deaf and blind. They even say “Mama Heidi” has raised the dead. On this episode of Heaven Bent, Tara Jean Stevens explores the divine healing ministry of Mozambique missionary and Toronto Blessing follower: Heidi Baker. Plus, what does science teach us about “speaking in tongues”? And, birthdates, the names of your children, the description of your childhood home – where does Prophet Shawn Bolz get his ‘words of wisdom’ from? He says it’s the Holy Spirit. His critics say… it’s the internet.

episodes.title: S1E1: The Revival
episodes.description: In 1994, a small church next to Toronto Pearson International Airport suddenly became one of the city’s “Top Tourist Attractions”. Why did millions of Christians flock from around the world? Was something truly supernatural happening? 25 years later, join Tara Jean Stevens as she revisits the unusual spiritual movement she was a part of as a teenager.

episodes.title: S1 TRAILER: The Toronto Blessing
episodes.description: Tara Jean Stevens was a teenager when a bizarre spiritual movement spread from Toronto to her childhood church in Prince Rupert, British Columbia. Why did worshipers shake and fall to the ground? Did anyone truly get healed? And did gold teeth miraculously appear in people’s mouths…or not? Join Tara Jean on her curious journey to find out.
